summary: The Healthcare Cybersecurity Act of 2025 aims to enhance cybersecurity in the Healthcare and Public Health Sector. Key provisions include: Agency coordination with the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), including a liaison; training for healthcare owners and operators on cybersecurity risks; an updated sector-specific risk management plan; identification of high-risk covered assets; and various reports to Congress. The bill focuses on improving information sharing, resource allocation, and threat mitigation within the healthcare sector to protect against cyberattacks.
